text:
This is a 68 year-old woman POD 5 s/p ventral hernia repair.
   Post-operative course complicated by tachycardia, persistent fevers,
   and altered mental status. Recent surgery at OSH for SBO complicated by
   wound infection and abscess as well as ventral hernia, which was the
   subject of this current surgery. Central line inserted on [**9-9**],
   peripheral IV for IV contrast was tried by IV nurse and the team under
   ultrasound guidance, to no avail. CT was then done with only with oral
   contrast. CT scan of abdomen and sinuses done on [**9-20**], continued on
   Vancomycin and Zosyn. The CT scan of abdomen of abdomen showed a
   hematoma. Pt needs to be sent to OR for evacuation of hematoma.
   Acute Pain
   Assessment:
   Pt c/o constant pain; at times verbalizes abdominal pain [**9-2**], other
   times just moans and the pain cannot be scored, tachycardiac and had a
   short episode of HR in 150s and BP above 160/100  after she came back
   from CT scan of abdomen and sinuses.
   Action:
   Received Dilaudid 2-4 mg IV Q 2-4 hrs. Given 500 cc NS bolus, also
   given 10 mg Lopressor IV  for tachycardia.
   Response:
   Pain is still constant, HR 120s, BP one teens, afebrile, Temp has been
   less than 100 all throughout the shift.
   Plan:
   Continue assessing pain and V/S, consider starting a standing order of
   pain medication and probably anxiolytics.
   Thromboembolism, other
   Assessment:
   Pt was found to have DVT in Rt IJ; right arm is swollen, cool to touch,
   and blanchable secondary to? clot..
   Action:
   Rt arm elevated over 2 pillows. Pt was started on Heparin drip at 1500
   units/hr.
   Response:
   PTT and INR high at the start of Heparin drip. Heparin stopped at 5: 30
   am for OR.
   Plan:
   Check PTT, ?? resume heparin post-op for DVT.
   Anemia, other
   Assessment:
   Pt looks pale; Hct was 23.1, then 24.2.
   Action:
   Pt transfused with one unit of blood (still being infused)
   Response:
   No reaction to one unit of PRBCs.
   Plan:
   Check Hct around 8 a.m. and assess s/s of bleeding, transfuse as
   needed.
   Others:
   Potassium was 3.1, repleted with IV KCL as per sliding scale. Calcium
   gluconate also given, pt to receive potassium phosphate when available
   from the pharmacy.
   NG tube was attached to low intermittent suction, no drainage, stool
   for C-Diff sent.
   FS was 165, insulin given per sliding scale.
   Wound cleaned and packed 2x, dressing was soaked with moderate
   serosanguinous secretions, presently dry, clean, and intact.
   U/O was low, received NS bolus with moderate effect.
